security_audit.summary: Official template skill with only placeholder text and no executable logic. No security concerns observed in the single file reviewed.

content.value_statement: You need a clean starting point for a new skill file. This template provides the required metadata header and a place to add instructions.
actual_capabilities: Defines a skill name in YAML front matter.
Defines a skill description field in YAML front matter.
Provides a markdown header for instructions.
Includes a placeholder section to add guidance.
limitations: Contains no executable logic or automation.
Provides no tool integrations or workflows.
Requires full customization for real use.

use_cases.title: Draft a new skill file
use_cases.description: Start a new skill with the required fields and a clear place to write instructions.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill format
use_cases.description: Use the template to keep skill metadata consistent across a team.

use_cases.title: Prototype internal skills
use_cases.description: Quickly scaffold a skill file before adding domain specific steps.

prompt_templates.title: Fill in the basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the template with a clear name, description, and three instruction bullets for a simple documentation helper skill.

prompt_templates.title: Add workflow steps
prompt_templates.prompt: Expand the instruction section into a step by step workflow for triaging bug reports.

prompt_templates.title: Add tool usage rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Add rules for when to read files and when to avoid edits, keeping the template format.

prompt_templates.title: Finalize a skill draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Refine the template into a complete skill with scope, constraints, and example prompts.

output_examples.input: Turn this template into a skill for writing release notes.
output: Set the skill name and description for release note drafting.
Add instructions to gather changes, group by feature, and write concise summaries.
Include guidance to confirm version and date before output.

best_practices: Replace placeholders with specific, testable instructions.
Keep descriptions short and usage focused.
Document inputs and expected outputs in the instructions.
anti_patterns: Leaving placeholder text in published skills.
Claiming capabilities not defined in the file.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a plain text template and works across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It only provides structure and does not implement any behavior.

faq.question: Can I integrate tools or scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, you must add those instructions yourself in the template.

faq.question: Does it collect or send data?
faq.answer: No. It contains only static text with no data handling.

faq.question: What if my skill does not load?
faq.answer: Check that the YAML fields are valid and the file path is correct.

faq.question: How does this compare to a complete skill?
faq.answer: A complete skill adds concrete steps, constraints, and examples.
